page.title: 08Recreation in Yelden
page.content: In Yelden recently an area of 1 acre adjacent to the church yard has been leased as a playing field for the sum of Â£100 per. annum. Villagers raised the money for this from holding a cheese and wine party and an old tyme dance. This summer a small fete was held on the field which included such games as: throwing a ballon full of water and seeing how many marbles one could get in an upturned flower pot using a spoon. there was also a rounders match between the children and the adults. Â£105 was raised for use by the playing fields association. The Parish Council Amenities Committee have recently allotted Â£100 per year to the playing field. Other activities incclude darts and skittles in the village pub. The village hall can be hired for dances.
